Is there a man who has escaped his wickedness? Man is tried according to his way,
Each is repaid according to his deeds. Your oppressors shall be cut off from around you,
O Tsiyon, And all who hate you shall be dispersed. Your praise is pleasing, O Tsiyon;
It rises up in all the world. I remember you many times for a beraḵah,
And I baraḵ you with all My heart. You shall attain to everlasting righteousness,
And shall receive bireḵoth from the noble. Take the vision which speaks of you,
And the dreams of the neḇi’im requested for you. Be exalted and increase, O Tsiyon,
And praise the Most High, your Redeemer! May my being rejoice in Your esteem!
A song to the Name of HWHY. In the midst of the congregation they shall praise
the Name of HWHY, For He has come to judge every action,
To remove the wicked from the earth, So that the children of wickedness shall not be found. The shamayim shall give their dew,
And there shall be no drought within their boundaries. The earth shall give its fruit in its time,
And its produce shall not fail. The fruit trees shall give of the fruit of its
vineyards, And the ground shall not deprive of its produce. The poor shall eat, and those who revere Elohim
shall be filled. 1064
A song to Yahuḏah. The shamayim and earth shall give praise
together. Let all the stars of the evening twilight give praise! Rejoice, Yahuḏah; rejoice!
Rejoice, rejoice and be glad with gladness! Celebrate your Feasts, and pay your vows;
For there is no wickedness in your midst. Raise your hand, and fortify your right hand!
Behold, the enemy shall perish,
And all the workers of wickedness shall be dispersed; But You, O HWHY, are forever,
And Your esteem shall be forever and ever. HalleluYah!
A song to the Creator.
And abundance of many waters comes after Him.
And He establishes the dawn by the knowledge of His heart. All His messengers sang when they saw it;
For He showed them that which they had not known. He crowns the mountains with fruit,
With good food for all the living. May the Aḏon of the earth be baraḵ, along with
His power; For He establishes the world by His wisdom. He stretched out the shamayim by His
understanding, And brought forth wind from His stores. 1065
And raised mist from the end of the earth. 1066
Love righteousness, you that are rulers of the earth. Think of HWHY in goodness and seek Him in integrity of heart. For He is found by those who do not try Him,
And reveals Himself to those who do not distrust Him. For perverse thoughts separate from Elohim,
And His power, when it is tried, reproves the unwise. For wisdom does not enter into a malicious being,
Nor dwell in the body that is subject to sin.
And turns away from thoughts that are without understanding, And does not remain when unrighteousness comes in. For wisdom is a loving spirit,
But a blasphemer shall not go unpunished for his words. For Elohim is witness of his kidneys, And a true watcher of his heart, and a hearer of his tongue. For the Ruaḥ of HWHY fills the world,
And that which sustains all knows what is said. Therefore he who speaks unrighteous words is
not hidden, Nor does vengeance pass him by when it punishes. For a search shall be made into the counsels of
the wicked, And the words of his voice shall come to HWHY to reveal his wicked deeds. For a jealousy ear hears all words,
And the sound of grumbling is not hidden. Therefore beware of grumbling, which is useless,
And keep your tongue from secrecy. For no secret word is without evil, And a lying mouth destroys the being. 1067
And do not pull destruction upon yourself with the works of your hands. For Elohim did not make death,
Nor does He delight in the destruction of the living. For He created all to have their life;
And the creations of the world were perfect, And no poison of destruction in them, Nor the reign of death upon the earth; For righteousness is immortal.
But wicked men with their works and words called
it to them, For when they thought to have it their friend, they perished to naught, And made a covenant with it, Because they deserve to receive a share in it.

For the wicked, reasoning with themselves, but not rightly said, “Our life is short and tedious, And of the death of a man there is no healing; Neither was there any man known to have returned from the grave. “For we are all born by chance,
And after this we shall be as though we had never been; For the breath of our nostrils is as smoke, And a little spark in the moving of our heart; Which being extinguished, our body shall be
turned into ashes, And our spirit shall vanish as the soft air. “And our name shall be forgotten in time,

And no man shall remember our works, And our life shall pass away as the traces of a cloud, And shall be dispersed as a mist, That is driven away with the rays of the sun, And overcome by its heat. “For our time is but a shadow that passes away;
And after our end there is no returning: For it is sealed up so that no man comes again. 1068
found, And let us hasten to use the creation as in youth. “Let us fill ourselves with costly wine and
ointments, And let no flower of the spring pass by us. “Let us crown ourselves with rosebuds, before
they wither. “Let none of us go without his part of our luxuries;
Let us leave signs of our joy in every place, For this is our portion, and this is our lot. “Let us oppress the poor, righteous man;
Let us not spare the widow, Nor regard the old grey hairs of the aged. “Let our strength be the law of righteousness,
For that which is feeble is found to be worthless. “Therefore let us lie in wait for the righteous;

For he is not for our way, and he is clearly opposed to our actions; He reproaches us with our guilt of the Law, And to our shame, accuses of the sins against our teaching. “He professes to have the knowledge of Elohim,
And calls himself the child of HWHY! “He has become a reproof to our thoughts.
“He is a burden to us to even look at,
For his life is not like other men, His ways are a different way. “We are regarded by him as false,
He abstains from our ways as from filthiness, He pronounces the end of the righteous to be baruḵ, And makes his boast that Elohim is his Father! “Let us see if his words are true,
And let us prove what shall befall him in the end. “For if the righteous man is the son of Elohim,
He shall help him, and deliver him from the hand of his enemies. 1069
So that we may know his humility, And prove his patience. “Let us condemn him with a shameful death;
For by his own words, he shall be favoured.” Such as these they devised, and were deceived;
For their own wickedness has blinded them. As for the secrets of Elohim, they did not know
them; Neither did they expect the wages of righteousness, Nor discern a reward for blameless lives. For Elohim created man to be immortal,
And made him to be an image of His own immortality. Nevertheless death came into the world through
envy of the devil, And those who hold to His side find it.
But the beings of the righteous are in the hand of Elohim, And no torture shall touch them. In the eyes of the unwise they seemed to die,
And their departure is taken for misery, And their going from us to be utter destruction:
But they are at peace. For though they are punished in the eyes of men,
Yet their expectancy is full of immortality. And having been discipled a little, they shall be
rewarded greatly; For Elohim proved them, and found them worthy for Himself. He has tried them as gold in the furnace,
And received them as a burnt offering. And in the time of their visitation they shall shine,
And run to and fro like sparks among the stubble. They shall judge the nations, and reign over the
people, And their Aḏon shall reign forever. Those that put their trust in Him shall understand
their own schemes, Who have neglected the righteous, and forsaken HWHY. For whoever despises wisdom and instruction is
miserable, And their expectancy is vain, their labours unfruitful, And their works unprofitable. Their wives are foolish, and their children wicked;
Their offspring are cursed.
Therefore baruḵ is the barren one who is undefiled, Who has not known the sinful bed; She shall bear fruit in the visitation of lives. And baruḵ is the eunuch, who has done no evil

with his hands, Nor devised wickedness against Elohim; For unto him shall be given the special gift of belief, And an inheritance more desired by his being in the Hĕyḵal ofHWHY. For the fruit of good labours is esteemed,
And the root of wisdom shall never fail. As for the children of adulterers, they shall not
come to their perfection, And the seed of an unrighteous bed shall be uprooted. For though they live long, yet they shall be
regarded as naught, And their end shall be without esteem. Or, if they die quickly, they have no expectancy,
Nor comfort in the day of trial. For the end of the unrighteous generation is
terrible.
It is better to have no children, and to have virtue, For the remembrance of it is forever; Because it is known with Elohim, and with men. 1071
And when it is gone, they desire it. It wears a crown, and overcomes forever, Having overcome, striving for undefiled rewards. But the multiplying brood of the wicked shall not
thrive, Nor take deep root by illegitimate seed, Nor lay any lasting foundation. For though they flourish as branches for a time;
Though standing - not last, they shall be shaken by the wind, And through the force of winds they shall be uprooted. The imperfect branches shall be broken off,
Their fruit unprofitable - not ripe to eat, Also of no use. For children brought forth by lawless beds are
witnesses of wickedness against their parents in their trial. But though the righteous be prevented by death,
Yet he shall be at rest. For esteemed age is not that which stands in
length of time, Nor measured by number of years. But wisdom is the grey hair unto men,
And an unstained life is old age. He pleased Elohim, and was loved by Him;
So that living among sinners he was translated. Indeed, was he taken away speedily,
Lest wickedness should alter his understanding, Or deceit deceive his being. For the enticement of greed obscures that which
is honest; And the wandering of desire undermines the simple minded. He, being made perfect in a short time, filled a
long time; 1072
Therefore He hastened to take him away from among the wicked. This the people saw, but did not understand,
Neither did they lay up this in their minds:
the wicked who are living; And youth that is soon perfected; The many years and old age of the unrighteous. For they shall see the end of the wise,
And shall not understand what Elohim in His counsel has decreed for Him, And to what end HWHY has put Him in safety. They shall see Him, and despise Him;
But Elohim shall laugh them to scorn. And from then on they shall be an insignificant carcass, And a reproach among the dead forever. For He shall tear them, and throw them down

headlong, that they shall be speechless; And He shall shake them from the foundation; And they shall be utterly laid waste, and be in sorrow; And their remembrance shall perish. And when they draw up the account of their sins,
they shall come with fear; And their own wickednesses shall convict them to their face.
Then the righteous shall stand in great boldness before the face of those who have afflicted Him, and taken no account of His works. When they see it, they shall be troubled with
awesome fear, and shall be amazed at the mystery of His salvation, so far beyond all that they looked for. And they, repenting and groaning for anguish of
spirit, shall say within themselves, “This was He, 1073
end to be without esteem. “How is He numbered among the children of
and the light of righteousness has not shined upon us, and the brilliance of righteousness did not rise upon us. “We wearied ourselves in the way of wickedness
and destruction; we have also gone through deserts where there was no path; but as for the Way of HWHY, we have not known it. “What has pride profited us, or what good has
wealth with our boasting brought us?” All these have passed away like a shadow,
And as a rumour that hastened away. And as a ship that passes over the waves of the
water, Which when it has passed, the trace of it is unable to be found, Neither the pathway of the keel in the waves. Or as when a bird has flown through the air,

There is no sign of its way to be found, But the air being lightly beaten with the stroke of its wings and parted with the rapid noise and motion of them is passed through; And after passing there is no sign of it to be found.
It parts the air, which immediately comes together again, So one cannot know where it went through. Even so, we also, as soon as we were born,
Began to draw to our end and had no sign of uprightness to show, But were consumed in our wickedness. For the expectancy of the unrighteous is like dust
that is blown away with the wind; 1074
Even so, their reward is with HWHY, And the Most High looks after them. Therefore they shall receive an esteemed reign,
and a lovely crown from the hand of HWHY: For with His right hand He shall cover them, And with His arm He shall protect them. He shall take his ardour as complete armour,
And make creation His weapon for the vengeance of His enemies. He shall put on righteousness as a breastplate,
And true judgment in place of a helmet.
He shall sharpen His severe wrath as a sword,
And the earth shall fight with Him against the foolish. Then the thunderbolts aimed true shall go out;
And from the clouds, as from a well drawn bow,
a stone out of bow, And the water of the sea shall rage against them, And the floods shall cruelly drown them. A mighty wind shall also stand up against them,
And blow them away like a storm: So wickedness shall lay waste the whole earth, And evil works shall overthrow the thrones of the mighty.
Hear therefore, O you sovereigns, and understand;
And boast in the multitude of nations. For power is given to you from HWHY,
And rulership from the Most High, 1075
ruled rightly, Nor guarded the Law, Nor walked after the counsel of Elohim; He shall come upon you terribly and speedily;
For a sharp judgment shall be to those who are in high places. For kindness shall soon pardon the harshest,
But great men shall be greatly tortured. For He who is Aḏon over all shall show no
partiality, Neither shall he stand in awe of any man’s greatness; For he has made the small and great, And is concerned for all alike. But a severe trial shall come upon the mighty.
I speak unto you therefore, O sovereigns,
That you may learn wisdom, and not fall away.
Desire them, and you shall be instructed. Wisdom is esteemed, and never fades away:
Also, she is easily seen by those who love her, And found by those who seek her. She prevents those who desire her,
In making herself first known to them. Whoever seeks her early shall have no great
hardship: For he shall find her sitting at his doors. Therefore to think upon her is perfection of
wisdom; And whoever watches for her shall quickly be without worry. For she goes about seeking those who are worthy
of her, 1076
discipline; And the concern of discipline is love; And love is the keeping of her Laws; and guarding
her Laws is the assurance of incorruption; And incorruption makes us near to Elohim:
Therefore the desire of wisdom leads to a reign.
If your delight then is in thrones and sceptres,
O rulers of the people, esteem wisdom, That you may reign for forever. As for wisdom, what she is, and how she came to
be, I shall tell you, and shall not hide mysteries from you; But shall seek her out from the beginning of her creation, And bring the knowledge of her into light,
For such a man shall have no fellowship with wisdom. But the multitude of the wise is the welfare of the
world: And a wise sovereign is the upholding of the people. Receive therefore instruction through my words,
And it shall do you good.
I myself am also a mortal man like all, And the offspring of he who was first made from the earth. And was fashioned in my mother’s womb to be
flesh in the time of ten months, Being compacted in blood, of the seed of man, And the pleasure that came with sleep. And when I was born, I drew in the common air,
And fell upon the earth, which is of like nature, And the first voice which I uttered was crying, as all others do. I was nursed with compassion, and wrapped in
garments. 1077
beginning of birth. For all men have one entrance into life,
And the same going out. Therefore I prayed, and understanding was given
to me. I called upon Elohim, and the spirit of wisdom came to me. I preferred her before sceptres and thrones,
And deemed wealth naught in comparison to her. Neither did I compare her to any precious stone,
Because all gold in respect to her is as a little sand, And silver is counted as clay before her. I loved her above health and loveliness,
And chose to have her instead of light; For the light that comes from her never goes out. All good came to me together with her,
And much wealth in her hands. And I rejoiced in them all, because wisdom goes
before them; And I did not know that she was the mother of them. I learned diligently, and speak of her freely.
I do not hide her wealth, For she is a treasure unto men that never fails;
Which those who use become the friends of Elohim, Being commended for the gifts that come from learning. Elohim has granted me to speak as I would,
And to conceive what is right for that which has been given to me; Because it is He who leads unto wisdom, and directs the wise. For in His hand are both we and our words;
All wisdom also, and knowledge of workmanship. For He has given me certain knowledge of that
which exists, Namely, to know how the world was made, And the operation of the elements. 1078
The alterations of the turning of the sun, And the change of seasons. The circuits of years, and the positions of stars.
The nature of living creatures, and the raging of
wild beasts; The violence of winds, and the reasonings of men; The diversities of plants and the power of roots. And all that which is either secret or revealed,
these I know. For wisdom, which is the worker of all matters,
taught me;
powerful, overseeing all, and penetrating all spirits most wise, understanding, and pure. For wisdom is more moving than any motion:
She passes and penetrates all because of her purity. For she is the breath of the power of Elohim,
And a pure force flowing from the esteem of the Almighty; Therefore no uncleanness shall come upon her. For she is the brightness of the everlasting Light,
The unspotted reflection of the power of Elohim, And an image of His goodness. And although one, she does all matters:
And remaining in herself, she renews all matters.
wisdom. For she is more lovely than the sun,
And above all the order of stars: Compared with the light, she is found before it. For after this comes night,
But evil shall not prevail against wisdom. 1079
Wisdom reaches from one end to another mightily; And she rightly orders all matters. I loved her, and sought her out from my youth,
I desired to make her my bride, and I was a lover of her comeliness. She increases her nobility for she accompanies
Elohim; Indeed, the Aḏon of all loved her. For she knows the secrets of the knowledge of
Elohim, And is a lover of His works. If wealth is a possession to be desired in this life;
What is wealthier than wisdom, the doer of all? And if insight works;
Who of all that is a more skilled worker than she? And if a man loves righteousness, her works are
good; For she teaches self-control and insight, righteousness and endurance; Of which there is naught more profitable than men may have in their life. If a man desires much experience, she knows the

ways of old, And concludes rightly what is to come: She knows the wisdom of words, and expounds hidden riddles. She foresees signs and wonders, and the events of seasons and times. Therefore I purposed to take her to me to live with
me, Knowing that she would be a counsellor of good, And a comfort in worries and grief. Because of her I have esteem among the
multitude, And esteem with the elders, although I am young. I shall be found alert in judgment,
And shall be admired in the sight of great men. When I hold my tongue, they shall await me,
And when I speak, they shall give good ear to me; 1080
And leave an everlasting remembrance behind me to those that come after me. I shall put the people in order,
And the nations shall be subject to me. Horrible tyrants shall be afraid, when they hear of
me; I shall be found good among the multitude, And courageous in battle. After I have come into my house, I shall find rest
with her: For her ways are not bitter; And to live with her has no sorrow, but gladness and joy. Now when I thought on these matters within
myself, And considered them in my heart, That to be allied with wisdom is immortality; And it is great pleasure to have her friendship;

And in the works of her hands are wealth without limit; And walking in her company, insight; And in talking with her, a good report; I went about seeking how to take her to me. For I was a lively child, and had a good spirit.
Indeed, being good, I came into a body undefiled.
Nevertheless, when I perceived that I could not
otherwise obtain her, except Elohim gave her me; And that was a point of wisdom also to know whose gift she was; I prayed to HWHY, and pleaded with Him, And with my whole heart I said,
“O Elohim of my fathers, and Aḏon of kindness, who has made all by Your Word, and ordained man through Your wisdom,
That he should reign over the creatures which You have made. 1081
and righteousness, And execute right-ruling with an upright heart: “Give me wisdom, that sits by Your throne;
And do not reject me from among your children. “For I, Your servant and son of Your female
servant am a weak man, and short-lived, And too young for the understanding of Right- Ruling and Laws. “For though a man be ever so perfect among the
children of men, Yet if Your wisdom is not with him, he shall be regarded as naught. “You have chosen me to be a sovereign of Your
people, And a judge of Your sons and daughters. “You have commanded me to build a Hĕyḵal upon
works, And was present when You made the world, And knew what was acceptable in Your sight, And right by Your Commands.
And from the throne of Your esteem, That being present she may labour with me, That I may know what is pleasing to You. “For she knows and understands all matters,
And she shall lead me sensibly in my doings, And preserve me in her power. “So shall my works be acceptable,
And then shall I judge Your people righteously, And be worthy to sit in my father’s seat.” For what man is he who knows the counsel of
Elohim? Or who knows the desire of HWHY? 1082
And our plans are of uncertainty. For the corruptible body presses down the being,
And this earthly tent weighs down the mind that thinks upon many matters. And we could hardly guess rightly at that which is
on earth, And with labour we find that which is before us; But that which is in the shamayim who has searched out? And Your counsel who has known, except You
give wisdom,
were instructed, And men were taught that which is pleasing to You, And were saved through wisdom.
She preserved the first formed father of the world, Who was created alone, and brought him out from his fall, And gave him power to rule all creatures.
But when the unrighteous went away from her in
his wrath, He also perished in the fury with which he murdered his brother. For whose cause the earth being drowned with
the flood, Wisdom again preserved it, And directed the course of the righteous within a piece of wood of little value. And the nations being confounded in their wicked
conspiracy, She found out the righteous, And preserved him blameless before Elohim, And kept him strong despite his tender compassion toward his son. When the wicked perished, she delivered the
righteous man, 1083

wasteland is a witness even to this day, And plants bearing fruit that never come to ripeness; And a standing pillar of salt is a monument of an unbelieving being. For not regarding wisdom, they not only received

this evil; That they did not know that which was good; But also left behind them a remembrance to the world of their foolishness; So that the matters in which they sinned could not so much as be hidden. But wisdom delivered those who attended to her
from pain. When the righteous fled from his brother’s wrath
she guided him in right paths, Showed him the reign of Elohim, and gave him
she stood by him, and made him wealthy. She defended him from his enemies, and kept him
safe from those that lay in wait, And in heavy conflict she gave him the deliverance; That he might know that good is stronger than all. When the righteous was sold, she did not forsake
him, But delivered him from sin: She went down with him into the pit, And did not leave him in chains, till she brought
him the sceptre of the reign, And power against those who oppressed him: As for those who had accused him, she showed them to be liars, And gave him everlasting esteem. 1084
seed from the nation that oppressed them. She entered into the being of the servant of HWHY,
And withstood awesome sovereigns with wonders and signs; Rendered to the righteous a reward for their
labours, Guided them in a marvellous way, and was a cover unto them by day, And a light by stars in the night time; Brought them through the Sea of Reeds,
And led them through deep waters. But she drowned their enemies, and threw them
up from the depth of the sea. Therefore the righteous plundered the wicked,
And taught the tongues of those who could not speak.
She prospered their works in the hand of the
uninhabited, And pitched tents in places where there lay no way. They stood against their enemies,
And were avenged of their adversaries. When they were thirsty, they called upon You,
And water was given them out of the flinty rock, And their thirst was quenched out of the solid rock. For in what matters their enemies were punished,
By the same they in their need were benefited. For instead of a constant running river troubled
with foul blood, For a visible reproof of that command, whereby
the infants were slain, You gave to them abundance of water by means of which they had no expectancy; 1085
punished their adversaries. For when they were tried although chastised in
kindness, They knew how the wicked were judged in wrath and tortured, Thirsting in a different manner than the righteous. For these You admonish and try, as a Father,
But the other, as a severe Sovereign, You condemn and punish. Whether they were absent or present,
They were punished alike. For a double grief came upon them,
And a groaning for the remembrance of what was past. For when they heard through their own
punishments the other had benefited, They sensed that it was from HWHY. For whom they treated with scorn,
When he was sent out long before the throwing out of the infants, In the end, when they saw what came to be, they admired him. But for the foolish schemes of their wickedness,
Being deceived, they worshipped serpents empty of reason, and vile beasts, You sent a multitude of beastly creatures upon them for vengeance; That they might know, that in all the ways a man
sins, By the same he shall also be punished. For Your Almighty hand, that made the world of
formless matter, Did not lack the means to send a multitude of bears or fierce lions among them, Or newly created, unknown wild beasts full of
rage, Breathing out either fiery breath, or a filthy stench of 1086
once, But also the terrible sight utterly destroy them. And even without all these they might have

collapsed with one blast, Being punished by vengeance, and scattered abroad through the breath of Your power; But You have ordered all in measure and number and weight. For You show Your great power at all times when
you desire; And who withstands the strength of Your arm? For the whole world is like a small grain in the
balance before You, Even as a drop of the morning dew that falls down upon the earth. But You show favour upon all;
For You do all, And overlook the sins of men, that they should repent. For You love all that exist, and loathe none whom
You have made; For You would never have made any matter, if You had hated it. And how could any matter have endured, if it had
not been Your desire? Or been preserved, if not called by You? But You spare all: for they are Yours, O HWHY,
You lover of the living.
For Your incorruptible Ruaḥ is in all. Therefore little by little You discipline those who
offend, And warn them by keeping them in remembrance of that in which they have sinned, So that turning from their wickedness they believe on You, O HWHY. 1087
works of witchcraft and wicked slaughterings; And also those cruel murderers of children,
And devourers of the flesh of man, and the feasts of blood, With their priests from among their idolatrous
group, And the parents, that killed helpless lives with their own hands; So that the land, which You esteemed above all
other, Might receive a worthy assembly of children of Elohim. Nevertheless even those You spared, being but
men, And sent hornets - forerunners of your host - to destroy them little by little. Not that You were unable to bring the wicked
under the hand of the righteous in battle, Or to destroy them at once with cruel beasts, or with one stern word; But executing Your judgments upon them little by

little, You gave them place for repentance, not being ignorant that they were a wicked generation, And that their evil was inherited, and that their minds could never be changed. For it was a cursed seed from the beginning;
Neither for fear of any man did You pardon them for those matters in which they sinned. For who shall say, “What have You done?”
Or who shall withstand Your judgment? Or who shall accuse You for the nations that perish, whom You made? Or who shall come to stand against You, to be avenged for the unrighteous? 1088
after all, To whom You might show that Your judgment is not unrighteous. Neither shall sovereign or ruler be able to turn his
face against you for any whom You have punished. Even as You Yourself are righteous,
You order all righteously; Determining it not agreeable within Your power to condemn he who does not deserve to be punished. For Your power is the beginning of righteousness,
And because You are Aḏon of all, it causes You to show favour to all. For when men shall not believe that You are all
powerful, You show Your strength, And among those who know it You make their boldness manifest. But You, mastering Your power, rightly rule with
straightness, And command us with great favour; For You determine when You use Your power. But by such works You have taught Your people
that the righteous man should be kind, And have prepared Your children with good expectancy that You allow repentance for sins. For if You punished the enemies of Your children,
And those condemned to death, with such deliberation, giving them time and place, Whereby they might be delivered from their evil; With what great discernment You rightly ruled
Your own children, Unto whose fathers You have sworn, And made Covenants of good promises? Therefore, whereas You discipline us,
You scourge our enemies one thousand times more, To the intent that, when we judge, we should carefully 1089
unrighteously, You have punished them with their own abominations. For they went very far astray in the ways of
straying, And upheld for mighty ones, the beasts which even among their enemies were despised, Being deceived, as children of no understanding. Therefore unto them, as children without the use
of reason, You sent a judgment to mock them. But those who would not repent by that correction,
in which He scolded them, Shall feel a deserved judgment from Elohim. See, for what matters they grumbled, when they

were punished, That is, from those which they thought to be mighty ones; Being punished because of them, when they saw it, They acknowledged Him to be the true Elohim, whom before they refused to know: And therefore severe judgment came upon them.

Surely all men who are ignorant of Elohim, are worthless by nature, And could not know Him from the good which is seen; Neither by considering the works did they acknowledge the Craftsman; But supposed either fire, or wind, or the swift air,
Or the circle of the stars, or the raging water, Or the lights of the shamayim to be the mighty ones which govern the world. If they, being delighted with their loveliness, took
them to be mighty ones; Let them know how much better their Aḏon is; For the first Author of loveliness has created them. 1090
excellence, Let them understand by them, how much mightier He is that made them. For the greatness and loveliness of the creation is
seen in proportion to the maker of them. But yet for this they are the less to be blamed:
For perhaps they stray, seeking Elohim, And desire to find him. For being accompanied with His works they
search Him diligently, and believe their sight; Because that which is seen is lovely. However neither are they to be pardoned.
For if they were able to know so much, that they
could examine the world; How did they not sooner find out the Aḏon of such? But they are miserable, and their expectancy is in

dead objects, Who call them mighty ones, which are the works of men’s hands, Gold and silver fashioned with skill and likeness of beasts, Or a stone good for naught - the work of an aged hand. Now a carpenter that cuts timber, after he has

hewed down a tree suited for the purpose, And taken off all the bark round about with skill, And has fashioned it elegantly, and made a vessel from it fit for the service of man’s life; And after using the remains of his work to prepare
his food, has filled himself; And taking the very waste among that which

served no use, Being a crooked piece of wood, and full of knots, Has carved it diligently, when he had none else to do, And formed it by the skill of his knowledge, And fashioned it into the image of a man; Or made it like some lowly beast,
Laying it over with scarlet, and with paint colouring it 1091
Positioned it on a wall, and fastened it with iron – For he prepared for it that it might not fall,
Knowing that it was unable to help itself; For it is an image, and has need of help – Then he makes a prayer for his possessions, for
his wife and children, And is not ashamed to speak to that which has no life. For health he calls upon that which is weak;

For life he prays to that which is dead; For help he humbly pleads that which has the least means to help; And for a good journey he asks of that which cannot put a foot forward; And for gaining and getting, and for good success
of his hands, Asks ability to do from that which is most unable to do any deed.

Again, one preparing himself to sail, And about to pass through the raging waves, Calls upon a piece of wood more rotten than the vessel that carries him. For truly this was planned by desire for gain,
And the workman built it by his skill. But Your providence, O Father, guides it;
For You have made a path in the sea, and a safe way in the waves; Showing that You save from every danger:
Even though a man went to sea without regard. Nevertheless You do not want that the works of
Your wisdom should be idle, And therefore men committing their lives to a small piece of wood, And passing the rough sea in a weak vessel are saved. 1092
perished, The expectancy of the world governed by Your hand escaped in a weak vessel, And left a seed of generation to all ages. For baruḵ is the wood by which righteousness
comes. But an idol made with hands is cursed, as well as
he who made it; He, because he made it; And it, because, being corruptible, it was called a mighty one. For the wicked and his wickedness alike are both
hateful to Elohim. For that which is made shall be punished together
with he who made it. Therefore there shall even be a reckoning upon

the idols of the gentiles: For in the creation of Elohim they have become an abomination, And stumbling-blocks to the beings of men, And a snare to the feet of the unwise. For the devising of idols was the beginning of
spiritual whoring, And the creation of them the corruption of life. For neither were they from the beginning,
Nor shall they be forever. For by the conceit of men they entered into the
world, And therefore shall they come quickly to an end. For a father afflicted with untimely mourning,

When he has made an image of his child soon taken away, Now esteemed him as a mighty one, which was then a dead one, And delivered to those beneath him ceremonies and offerings. Thus over time an evil custom grew strong being
kept as a law, 1093

because they dwelt far away, They took the likeness of his image from afar, And made an exact likeness of a sovereign whom they esteemed, So that through their ardour they might flatter he who was absent, as if he were present. The skill of the craftsman also helped to impel the
ignorant to increased worship. For he, perhaps willing to please one in authority,
Forced all his skill to make the likeness in the best fashion. And so the multitude, attracted by the appeal of
the work, Accepted him now as a mighty one, Who a little before was only esteemed. And this was an occasion to deceive the world:
For men, serving either calamity or authority, Ascribed unto stones and stocks the Name not to be shared. And this was not enough for them, that they
strayed in the knowledge of Elohim; But while they lived in the great struggle of ignorance, Those great calamities they called peace. For while they slew their children in offerings,
Or performed secret ceremonies, or held wild festivals of strange rituals; No longer did they keep lives nor marriages
undefiled; But each one slew another in betrayal, or grieved him through adultery. So that there ruled in all men without exception:
Blood, murder, theft, and hypocrisy, Corruption, unbelief, confusion, falsehood, Distress of good men, forgetfulness of good,
defilement of beings, 1094
the beginning, the cause, and the end of all evil. For either they rave when they exult, or
prophesy lies, Or live unrighteously, Or else readily contradict themselves. For because their trust is in idols, which have no
life; Though they swear falsely, yet they expect no harm. However for both causes they shall be rightly
punished: Both because they did not think well of Elohim, Giving heed to idols, and also unrighteously swore in deceit,
swear: But it is the righteous vengeance of sinners, That always punishes the offense of the wicked.
But we shall not sin, knowing that we are considered Yours. For to know You, is perfect righteousness,
Also to know Your power is the root of immortality. For neither did the evil intention of men deceive
us, Nor an image spotted with various colours, The painter’s fruitless labour; The sight of which entices fools to lust after it,
And so they desire the form of a lifeless image that has no breath. Both those who make them, those who desire
them, and those who worship them, Are lovers of evil, and are worthy to have such to trust upon. 1095

vessel with much labour for our service; Indeed, of the same clay he makes both the vessels that serve for clean uses, And likewise also all those who serve the contrary. But to what is the use of either, the potter himself is the judge. And using his labours wickedly, he makes a vain

mighty one of the same clay, Even he which a little before was made of earth himself, And within a little while after returns to the same, When his life which was loaned to him shall be demanded. But his concern is, not that he shall have much

labour, Nor that his life is short; But strives to outdo goldsmiths and silversmiths, And endeavours to do like the workers in bronze, And counts it his esteem to make that which is counterfeit. His heart is ashes, his expectancy is cheaper than
dirt, And his life of less value than clay. Because he did not know his Maker,
And He who inspired into him an active being, And breathed in a living spirit. But they reckoned our life a game,
stumbling above all else, Making frail vessels and graven images. And all the enemies of Your people, that hold
them in subjection, are most foolish, And are more miserable than an infant. For they reckoned all the idols of the gentiles to be
mighty ones; 1096
own spirit fashioned them: But no man makes a mighty one that is like himself. For being mortal, he makes that which is dead
with wicked hands; For he himself is better than that which he worships; Whereas he lived once, but they never. Also, they worshipped those beasts that are also
most hateful; For being compared together, some are worse than others. Neither do they look good, so much as to be
desired regarding beasts: But they went without the praise of Elohim and His beraḵah.
Therefore by these they were rightly punished, And tortured by a multitude of beasts. Instead of this punishment, dealing favourably
with Your own people, You prepared for them delicacies for food, Even quails to arouse their appetite; So that they, desiring food,

Due to the ugly sight of the beasts sent among them, Might loathe even that which they desired. But these, suffering hardship for a short time, Might be made partakers of delicacies. For it was necessary, that upon those oppressors
suffering should come, which they could not avoid. But to these it should only be shown how their enemies were punished. For when the fearful fierceness of beasts came
upon them, And they perished with the stings of writhing 1097
might be warned, Receiving a sign of deliverance, to remind them of the Command of Your Law. For he who turned himself toward it was not saved
by that which he saw, But by You, who are the Saviour of all. And in this You made Your enemies confess,
That it is You who delivers from all evil. For the biting of locusts and flies killed them,
Neither was there found any healing for their life: For they deserved to be punished by such. But Your sons were not overcome by the very
fangs of venomous serpents, For Your kindness was continually upon them, and healed them. For they were pierced, that they should remember
Your Words, And were quickly delivered, So not to fall into deep forgetfulness, That they remember Your goodness. For it was neither herb, nor poultice, that healed
them, But Your Word, O HWHY, that heals all. For You have power of life and death.
You lead to the gates of She’ol, and bring up again. Because of his evil a man kills,
And the spirit, when it is gone, does not return; Neither the being that is taken up comes again. But it is impossible to escape Your hand.
For the wicked, that denied to know You,
Were beaten by the strength of Your arm; They were pursued with strange rains, hail and showers that they could not avoid, And they were consumed by fire. 1098
force in the water, that quenches all; For the world fights for the righteous. For at one time the flame was restrained,

That it might not consume the beasts that were sent against the wicked; But seeing this they might see that they were punished with the judgment of Elohim. And at another time it burns stronger than fire
even in the midst of water, That it might destroy the increase of an unrighteous land. Instead You fed Your own people with food of
messengers, And sent them bread from the shamayim prepared without their labour, Able to content every delight, and pleasant to every taste. For your sustenance revealed Your sweetness
toward Your children, And serving to the appetite of the eater, Rendered itself to every man’s liking. But snow and ice endured the fire, without
melting, That they might know that fire burning in the hail, and flashing in the rain, Destroyed the increase of their enemies. But this again forgot even its own strength,
That the righteous might be nourished. For the creation that serves You, the Maker,

Increases its strength against the unrighteous for their punishment. And diminishes its strength for the benefit of those who put their trust in You. Therefore even then was it changed into all forms.
And was obedient to Your favour, who sustains all, According to the desire of those who had need; That Your children, O HWHY, whom You love,
might know, 1099
Being warmed with a few rays of sun, soon melted away, That it might be known that we must rise before
the sun and give You thanks, And pray to you at the daybreak. For the expectancy of the unthankful shall melt
away as the winter frost, And shall run away as useless water.
For Your judgments are great, and cannot be expressed; Therefore beings not instructed have strayed. For when unrighteous men thought to oppress the
sins, They were scattered under a dark veil of forgetfulness, Being greatly astonished, and troubled with visions. For neither could the corner that held them keep
them from fear: But noises falling down sounded about them, And mournful visions appeared to them with a heavy presence. No power of the fire could give them light:
Nor could the bright flames of the stars endure to lighten that horrible night. Only a very dreadful fire kindled by itself appeared
to them; For being greatly afraid, they thought that which they saw to be worse than the sight they did not see. 1100
naught, And their boasting in wisdom was reproved with shame. For those who promised to drive away fear and
troubles from a sick being, Were sick themselves of fear, worthy to be laughed at. For though no fearsome matter frightened them;
Yet being scared of beasts that passed by, and hissing of serpents, They perished from fear,
Denying that they saw the air, which could in no way be avoided. For wickedness, condemned by her own witness,
Is very fearful, and being pressured by conscience, always foresees difficulties. For fear is naught but a betrayal of the support
which reason offers. And the expectation from within, being lesser,
Counts the ignorance greater than the cause which brings the torment. But they sleeping the same sleep that night, which
was indeed unbearable, And which came upon them out of the imminent depths of She’ol, Were on one hand tortured with fearsome visions,
And on the other hand fainted, their heart failing them; For a sudden unexpected fear came upon them. So then whoever fell down there was thus kept,
shut up in a prison without iron bars, For whether he were a farmer, or shepherd,
Or a labourer in the field, He was overtaken, and endured that unavoidable necessity; For they were all bound with one chain of darkness. Whether it wore a whistling wind,
Or a melodious noise of birds among the spreading 1101

Or a stampeding of beasts that could not be seen, Or a roaring voice of most savage wild beasts, Or a rebounding echo from the hollow mountains; These made them to faint for fear. For the whole world shone with radiant light,
And none were hindered in their labour; Over them alone was spread a heavy night,
An image of that darkness which would afterward receive them; But they were even more grievous unto themselves than the darkness.
whom they had been wronged before, they thanked them, And pleaded for their forgiveness that they had been enemies. Instead of this You gave them a burning pillar of
fire, Both to be a guide for the unknown journey, And a harmless sun to comfort them in esteem. For they deserved to be deprived of light and
imprisoned in darkness, Who had kept Your sons imprisoned, By whom the incorruptible light of the Law was to be given unto the world. And when they had determined to slay the infants
That knowing with certainty unto what promises they had trusted, They might afterwards be of good courage. So both the salvation of the righteous,
And destruction of their enemies was accepted by Your people. For by which You punished our adversaries,
By the same You esteemed us, whom You had called. For the righteous children of good men made
offerings secretly,
despairing cry of the enemies, And a grievous noise was spread abroad for children that were bewailed. The master and the servant were
punished after one manner; And the sovereign suffered the same as the common person. So altogether they had innumerable dead with one
kind of death; Nor were the living sufficient to bury them; For in one moment the most noble of their offspring was destroyed. For although they would not believe by reason of
their magic; Upon the destruction of the firstborn, they acknowledged these people to be the sons of Elohim. For while all was in quiet silence,
And that night was in the midst of its swift course, Your mighty Word leaped out of the shamayim
from Your royal throne, 1103
sword, And stood filling all with death; And it touched the shamayim, but stood upon the earth. Then suddenly visions of horrible dreams troubled
them greatly. And fears not sought for came upon them. And one thrown here, and another there half
dead, Revealed the cause of his death. For the dreams that troubled them forewarned
this, Lest they should perish, and not know why they were afflicted. Indeed, the taste of death touched the righteous
also, And there was a destruction of the multitude in the wilderness; But the wrath did not endure long. For then a blameless man hurried,

And stood forth to defend them; And bringing the shield of his own service, Even prayer, and the atonement of incense, Opposed the wrath, and brought the calamity to an end, Declaring that he was Your servant. So he overcame the destroyer, not with strength
of body, Nor with force of arms, But with a word subdued He who punished, Declaring the oaths and Covenants made with the fathers. For when the dead had fallen down in heaps one
upon another, Standing between, he held back the wrath, And parted the way to the living. 1104
And in the four rows of the stones was engraved the esteem of the fathers, And Your excellence upon the turban of his head. To these the destroyer yielded, and feared;
For it was enough that they only tasted the wrath.
As for the wicked, wrath came upon them without kindness to their end; For He knew before what they would do; How having allowed them to depart, and sent
them away in haste, They would reconsider and pursue them. For while they were still mourning and lamenting
at the graves of the dead, They added another foolish scheme, and pursued as fugitives, Those whom they had begged to leave. For the expectancy of which they were worthy,

drew them toward this end, And made them forget that which had already come to be, That they might fill the punishment of their torment which was lacking; And that Your people might travel an extraordinary
way, But they would find a strange death. For the whole creation in its kind was renewed in
fashion, Serving Your Commands that were given to them, That Your children might be guarded without harm; As a cloud overshadowing the camp.
And where water stood before, dry land appeared, And out of the Sea of Reeds, an unobstructed way; And out of the raging river, a green field, Where all the people went through that were
defended by Your hand, Seeing Your marvelous, awesome wonders. 1105
lambs, Praising you, O HWHY, who had delivered them. For they still remembered what was done while

they sojourned in the strange land, How the ground brought forth flies instead of cattle, And how the river threw up multitudes of frogs instead of fish. But afterwards they saw a new offspring of birds,
When being led with their appetite, they asked for luxurious meats. For quails came up to them from the sea for their
satisfaction. And punishments came upon the sinners,

Not without former signs of the power of thunder; For they suffered rightly according to their own wickedness, Because they exercised a harder and hateful behaviour toward sojourners. For the Seḏomites did not receive those who were
unknown when they came, But these brought friends into slavery, that deserved good from them. And not only so, but supposed some respect
would be had of those, Because they treated sojourners hatefully. But they afflicted those grievously, whom they had
received with feasting, And had already shared in the same laws with them. Therefore they were stricken with blindness,
As those at the doors of the righteous man; When being surrounded with great, horrible darkness, Every one sought to pass by his own doors. For the elements were changed in themselves by
a kind of harmony, As notes change the name of the tune on a harp And yet are always sounds; Which are understood by the sight of that which has been done. 1106
And that which before swam in the water, now moved on the earth. The fire had power in the water, forgetting its own
ability; And the water forgot its own quenching nature. On the contrary, the flames did not destroy the
flesh of the corruptible living matters, though they walked in them; Neither melted the frosty food from the shamayim that would naturally melt. For in all matters O HWHY,
You exalted Your people and esteemed them, Neither did You lightly regard them, But assisted them at every time and place. 1107

The Prologue: Whereas many and great matters have been delivered to us through the Torah and the neḇi’im and by others that have followed their paths, for which Yisra’ĕl ought to be commended for learning and wisdom; and of which not only the readers need to become competent themselves, but also those who desire to learn be able to benefit those who are outside, both by speaking and writing. My grandfather Yahoshua, when he had applied himself greatly to the reading of the Law, and the neḇi’im, and other Books of our fathers, and had acquired good judgment from them, was himself also led to write somewhat pertaining to learning and wisdom; to the intent that those who desire to learn, and are drawn to such, might profit much more in living according to the Law. Therefore let me plead that you read it with good intent and attention, and to pardon us for where we may seem to come short in some words, which we have laboured to interpret. For the same words spoken in Iḇri, and translated into another tongue, do not have the same force in them; and not only this, but the Law itself, and the neḇi’im, and the rest of the Books, have great difference, when they are spoken in their own language. For in the thirty-eighth year of coming into Mitsrayim, when Euergetĕs was sovereign, and continuing there some time, I found a book of great learning; therefore I thought it necessary for me to devote some diligence and labour to interpret it; using great vigilance and skill in that time to complete the book, and also publish it for those in a foreign land who are willing to learn, being prepared before in manners to live after the Law. 1108
All wisdom comes from HWHY, and is with Him forever. Who may number the sand of the sea and the
drops of rain, And the days of eternity? Who may search out the height of the shamayim,
And the breadth of the earth, and the deep, and wisdom? Wisdom has been created before all,
And the understanding of insight from everlasting. The Word of Elohim Most High is the fountain of
wisdom; And her ways are everlasting Commands. To whom has the root of wisdom been revealed?
Or who has known her wise counsels? Unto whom has the knowledge of wisdom been
